title: Crumbz Stepping Down

embed.description: Today our Jungler Alberto "Crumbzz" Rengifo has decided to step down from the active LCS roster. We wish him all the best and thank him for his hard work over the past 3 years. Website: http://team-dignitas.net/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/TeamDignitas Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TeamDignitas

body:
From the video description:
"Today our Jungler Alberto "Crumbzz" Rengifo has decided to step down from the active LCS roster. We wish him all the best and thank him for his hard work over the past 3 years."

replies.body:
At the end of the video, crumbz talks about how he caused problems in the past and that he did not get along with team mates then. I wonder if that is part of the reason QT and others decided to run from DIG.

Lets be honest here, DIG as a organization is messing up big time for over a year. Something is failing and the management leadership does not seem to exist. I remember Scarra saying last split on his stream he had to stream since he was not getting paid enough as DIG coach. DIG's owners need to realize that they are going to be 10th place if they do not show proper leader ship and support a meaningful staff.

In his defense, Jungling is considerably less rewarding and more difficult than it was in previous seasons. Rito has been screwing junglers for years, and teams nowadays are succeeding in spite of their junglers rather than because of them.
Hate to say it, but I think its a good thing, he hasn't really been performing recently. Really screwed my fantasy team

> [{quoted}](name=Woodsy2575,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Wky2eh0l,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-02-03T02:51:49.197+0000)
>
> Hate to say it, but I think its a good thing, he hasn't really been performing recently. Really screwed my fantasy team

It's not really his fault though, he relies just as much on his team to make plays as they rely on him.  And his team just doesn't know what they are or want to be at the moment.  Did you watch that last game?  You could tell he just didn't know what to do to bring his team back from the certain death two minutes in.  Also, that Annie ban.

how does that explain the last split. I have nothing against crumbz personally, but i wanted him gone before scarra left(became coach). It always felt like he only did well when his team did well. I never got the feeling that he was the cause of the win, just the follower. 

I may have high expectations of pro junglers. Though when someone plays at that pro level those expectations are normal.

> [{quoted}](name=Kchaosrei,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Wky2eh0l,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-02-03T12:44:55.557+0000)
>
> how does that explain the last split. I have nothing against crumbz personally, but i wanted him gone before scarra left(became coach). It always felt like he only did well when his team did well. I never got the feeling that he was the cause of the win, just the follower. 
> 
> I may have high expectations of pro junglers. Though when someone plays at that pro level those expectations are normal.

This is true, comparatively he just isn't as prevalent of a jungler as his pro jungler peers.  I realize he has had high points, but I've just never seen him as a play-making kind of player.  He is more of a goes with the flow sort of player, which sometimes a team needs.   Not a pro team, mind you, but still an important asset.  If his team is winning, he is taking them from winning to completely out of control winning.  If they are losing, he does silly things like go in 1v5 with a jarvan ulti.

ik this is prob obvius but how do these guys pull it off, my bro tells me lcs players usually retire after 1.5-3 years, and that to me is mind blowing, even traditional sports atheletes can't retire that fast. 

Now the second thing is the pressure to much or is it just that the dominate players a constantly shifting that they dont/cant stay for longer.

i dont particularly pay attention about lcs but this has me curious
Your brother sure seems informed on the long term trends of the LCS given that it's only been in existance for [less than] 3 years.

holy crap .-.

Exodus:qtpie, scarra, zion, etc.

> [{quoted}](name=Tang Bohu,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Wky2eh0l,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-02-05T02:56:23.764+0000)
>
> holy crap .-.
> 
> Exodus:qtpie, scarra, zion, etc.

So much sad.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sweet,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Wky2eh0l,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-02-05T03:24:51.816+0000)
>
> So much sad.

that's exactly my sentiments.... Also, Crumbz is sucha chill guy and he seems *really* upset over this. I feel for him. Luckily for me CLG's doing good and the Unicorns of Love popped up on the scene or everything LCS related would be saddening.

;-; someone hold me and say it's gonna be okay
